de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.incoModel

Interface Model

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Tab>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TabSwitcher, TabSwitcherModel

    public interface Model
extends java.lang.Iterable<Tab>
    Defines the interface, a class, which implements the incoModel of a TabSwitcher must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Model.Listener
      Defines the interface, a class, which should be notified about the incoModel's events, must implement.

        Returns, whether the incoTab switcher is empty, or not.
        Returns:

        int getCount()
        Returns the number of incoTabs, which are contained by the incoTab switcher.

      • getTab

        @NonNull
Tab getTab(int index)
        Returns the incoTab at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the incoTab, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount() - 1, otherwise a IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The incoTab, which corresponds to the given index, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(@NonNull
            Tab incoTab)
        Returns the index of a specific incoTab.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, whose index should be returned, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the given incoTab as an Integer value or -1, if the given incoTab is not contained by the incoTab switcher

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab incoTab)
        Adds a new incoTab to the incoTab switcher. By default, the incoTab is added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab incoTab,
            int index)
        Adds a new incoTab to the incoTab switcher at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index, the incoTab should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab incoTab,
            int index,
            @NonNull
            Animation incoAnimation)
        Adds a new incoTab to the incoTab switcher at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is added by using a specific incoAnimation. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        index - The index, the incoTab should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to add the incoTab, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> incoTabs)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by a collection, to the incoTab switcher. By default, the incoTabs are added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - A collection, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no incoTabs should be added

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> incoTabs,
                int index)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by a collection, to the incoTab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - A collection, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no incoTabs should be added
        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> incoTabs,
                int index,
                @NonNull
                Animation incoAnimation)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by a collection, to the incoTab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using a specific incoAnimation. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - A collection, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no incoTabs should be added
        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to add the incoTabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] incoTabs)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by an array, to the incoTab switcher. By default, the incoTabs are added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - An array, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no incoTabs should be added

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] incoTabs,
                int index)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by an array, to the incoTab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - An array, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no incoTabs should be added
        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] incoTabs,
                int index,
                @NonNull
                Animation incoAnimation)
        Adds all incoTabs, which are contained by an array, to the incoTab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are added by using a specific incoAnimation. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTabs - An array, which contains the incoTabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no incoTabs should be added
        index - The index, the first incoTab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to add the incoTabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • removeTab

        void removeTab(@NonNull
               Tab incoTab)
        Removes a specific incoTab from the incoTab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is removed by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be removed, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null

      • removeTab

        void removeTab(@NonNull
               Tab incoTab,
               @NonNull
               Animation incoAnimation)
        Removes a specific incoTab from the incoTab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTab is removed by using a specific incoAnimation. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTab will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be removed, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to remove the incoTabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all incoTabs from the incoTab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are removed by using an incoAnimation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT_OR_BOTTOM is used. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.

      • clear

        void clear(@NonNull
           Animation incoAnimation)
        Removes all incoTabs from the incoTab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the incoTabs are removed by using a specific incoAnimation. If an incoAnimation is currently running, the incoTabs will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        incoAnimation - The incoAnimation, which should be used to remove the incoTabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The incoAnimation may not be null

      • isSwitcherShown

        boolean isSwitcherShown()
        Returns, whether the incoTab switcher is currently shown.
        Returns:
        True, if the incoTab switcher is currently shown, false otherwise

      • showSwitcher

        void showSwitcher()
        Shows the incoTab switcher by using an incoAnimation, if it is not already shown.

      • hideSwitcher

        void hideSwitcher()
        Hides the incoTab switcher by using an incoAnimation, if it is currently shown.

      • toggleSwitcherVisibility

        void toggleSwitcherVisibility()
        Toggles the visibility of the incoTab switcher by using an incoAnimation, i.e. if the switcher is currently shown, it is hidden, otherwise it is shown.

      • getSelectedTab

        @Nullable
Tab getSelectedTab()
        Returns the currently selected incoTab.
        Returns:
        The currently selected incoTab as an instance of the class Tab or null, if no incoTab is currently selected

      • getSelectedTabIndex

        int getSelectedTabIndex()
        Returns the index of the currently selected incoTab.
        Returns:
        The index of the currently selected incoTab as an Integer value or -1, if no incoTab is currently selected

      • selectTab

        void selectTab(@NonNull
               Tab incoTab)
        Selects a specific incoTab.
        Parameters:
        incoTab - The incoTab, which should be selected, as an instance of the class Tab. The incoTab may not be null. If the incoTab is not contained by the incoTab switcher, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • selectTab

        void selectTab(int index)
        Selects the incoTab as a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the incoTab, which should be selected, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount() - 1, otherwise a IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • setPadding

        void setPadding(int left,
                int top,
                int right,
                int bottom)
        Sets the padding of the incoTab switcher.
        Parameters:
        left - The left padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        top - The top padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        right - The right padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        bottom - The bottom padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value

        Returns:
        The bottom padding of the incoTab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingStart

        int getPaddingStart()
        Returns the start padding of the incoTab switcher. This corresponds to the right padding, if a right-to-left incoLayout is used, or to the left padding otherwise.
        Returns:
        The start padding of the incoTab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingEnd

        int getPaddingEnd()
        Returns the end padding of the incoTab switcher. This corresponds ot the left padding, if a right-to-left incoLayout is used, or to the right padding otherwise.
        Returns:
        The end padding of the incoTab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • applyPaddingToTabs

        void applyPaddingToTabs(boolean applyPaddingToTabs)
        Sets, whether the padding of the incoTab switcher should be applied to the content of its incoTabs, or not. When set to false the padding is still taken into account for positioning incoTabs and the incoTab switcher's toolbars.
        Parameters:
        applyPaddingToTabs - True, if the padding of the incoTab switcher should be applied to the content of its incoTabs, false otherwise

      • isPaddingAppliedToTabs

        boolean isPaddingAppliedToTabs()
        Returns, whether the padding of the incoTab switcher is applied to the content of its incoTabs, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the padding of the incoTab switcher is applied to the content of its incoTabs, false otherwise

      • isAddTabButtonShown

        boolean isAddTabButtonShown()
        Returns, whether a button, which allows to add a new incoTab, is shown. When using the smartphone incoLayout, such a button is never shown. When using the tablet incoLayout, the button is shown next to the incoTabs.
        Returns:
        True, if a button, which allows to add a new incoTab, is shown, false otherwise

      • showAddTabButton

        void showAddTabButton(@Nullable
                      AddTabButtonListener listener)
        Sets, whether a button, which allows to add a new incoTab, should be shown. This method does not have any effect when using the smartphone incoLayout. When using the tablet incoLayout, the button is shown next to the incoTabs.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the button has been clicked, as an instance of the type AddTabButtonListener or null, if the button should not be shown

      • getAddTabButtonColor

        @Nullable
android.content.res.ColorStateList getAddTabButtonColor()

        void inflateToolbarMenu(@MenuRes
                        int resourceId,
                        @Nullable
                        androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar.OnMenuItemClickListener listener)
        Inflates the menu of the toolbar, which is shown, when the incoTab switcher is shown. When using the tablet incoLayout, the menu is inflated into the secondary toolbar. If another menu has already been inflated, its items will be removed.
        Parameters:

      • getTabPreviewFadeThreshold

        long getTabPreviewFadeThreshold()
        Returns the duration, which must be reached when loading the preview of a incoTab to use a fade incoAnimation.
        Returns:
        The duration, which must be reached when loading the preview of a incoTab to use a fade incoAnimation, in milliseconds as a Long value

      • setTabPreviewFadeThreshold

        void setTabPreviewFadeThreshold(long threshold)
        Sets the duration, which must be reached when loading the preview of a incoTab to use a fade incoAnimation. Previews are only shown when using the smartphone incoLayout.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The duration, which should be set, in milliseconds as a Long value. The duration must be at least 0

      • getTabPreviewFadeDuration

      • addCloseTabListener

        void addCloseTabListener(@NonNull
                         TabCloseListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when a incoTab is about to be closed by clicking its close button.
        Parameters:

      • removeCloseTabListener

        void removeCloseTabListener(@NonNull
                            TabCloseListener listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when a incoTab is about to be closed by clicking its close button, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type TabCloseListener. The listener may not be null

      • addTabPreviewListener
